timeline.bodyText: Doesn't the user need to delete in this case? So should it be a info, or even warn?
timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: We do not know it exists. But since we do not have access to delete it, we assume it does not exist since we did not had access to create it.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: It it's a KubernetesClientException I think there should be a status code, which might be a little less fragile than contains on the message.
timeline.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: I do not think there is any code which is exposed. This is the logic we use for the creation as well.
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: OK, but I think we should factor out a method for these, both here and for the creation.
replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: Hmm, good point. I'm not good at this programming thing ... but I excel in the copy-pasting discipline. And you know how it is ... when all you know is a Cmd-C/Cmd-V everything looks like a copy paste problem :-/. Anyway, it should be fixed now.
